job_history.work_description: Provide customer support for HRIS questions and issues by researching resolving simple to complex policy and transactional questions related to the use of the PeopleSoft HRIS and HR administrative policies and practices.
Daily support for the administration of all University benefits programs, including communications with vendors and third party administrators.
Management of the College's employee benefits programs and the Human Resources Information System (HRIS).
Managed annual open enrollment and payroll-related functions to include frozen salary, imputed income, rates information, EOI, direct bill for retirees and LOA

skills.name: HRIS Management
skills.explanation: Extensive experience managing HRIS systems, including PeopleSoft, and providing support for HRIS-related questions and issues, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Benefits Administration
skills.explanation: Long-term experience managing employee benefits programs, including communications with vendors and third-party administrators, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Payroll Management
skills.explanation: Significant experience with payroll-related functions, including frozen salary, imputed income, and direct bill for retirees, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Customer Support
skills.explanation: Extensive experience providing customer support for HRIS questions and issues, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Policy Administration
skills.explanation: Experience researching and resolving policy-related questions and issues, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Experience managing annual open enrollment and other projects, indicating a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Experience communicating with vendors, third-party administrators, and employees, indicating a solid working proficiency.
